basic.description: This course offers an interdisciplinary study of the impact on American thought of social Darwinism, industrialism, naturalism, the culture of consumption, radicalism, anticommunism, post-industrialism, and affluence. Examines the growth of cultural criticism as a task required of the 20th-century intellectual.
basic.subject: AMH
basic.title: US Intellectual History II: 1880 to the Present
